title: Tips and Tricks for Managing an EM Lab
content: The strategies to manage a successful electron microscopy (EM) lab can vary from one lab to another due to different work environment, composition of the users, and budget sources, etc. The end goal of successful management is to create a proficient and productive lab with high standards. Core lab management has many levels. At the business level, decisions are made to create structure such as financing, procurement, marketing, human resources, and services [1]. At the service level, some EM labs are operated as a fee for services core facility while others are set up to provide support to internal researchers. These various working environments create different challenges. The technologistsâ€™ role is to provide consistent, high-quality service that requires universal standards in operating procedures, lab safety, instrument training and maintenance [2]. This panel will discuss strategies to optimize the operation of EM labs in academic, government, industrial and corporate settings [3].
